required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Imparting of Practical Skills by Digital Methods
clinical_study.official_title: Imparting of Practical Skills by Digital Methods - Effectivity of Digital Education Under Conditions of the Pandemia Concerning the Application of Donati Suture and the Application of an Intraosseous Venous Access

brief_summary.textblock: Due to the corona pandemia and the consecutive reduction of teaching students face to face the imparting of medical skills is limited. Video sequences may be an adequate alternative to educate selected practical skills. So, the investigators intend to explore this aspect as a first concerning two basic medical skills: Donati suture and intraosseous venous access.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators will recruit last year medical students and randomise them into two groups: Group A and Group B. Both groups will be video recorded during the performance of the two skills on simulators (i.s. Donati suture and intraosseous venous access) (timepoint: T0). Then group A will watch a standardised video about the skills, and group B will do self-study. Then, both groups will be again video recorded during the performance of the two skills on simulators (timepoint: T1). After 1 week group B will watch the same standardised video about the skills, and group A will do self-study. Then both groups will be again video recorded during the performance of the two skills on simulators (timepoint: T2).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The investigators will recruit last year medical students and randomise them into two groups: Group A and Group B. Both groups will be video recorded during the performance of the two skills on simulators (i.s. Donati suture and intraosseous venous access) (timepoint: T0). Then group A will watch a standardised video about the skills, and group B will do self-study. Then, both groups will be again video recorded during the performance of the two skills on simulators (timepoint: T1). After 1 week group B will watch the same standardised video about the skills, and group A will do self-study. Then both groups will be again video recorded during the performance of the two skills on simulators (timepoint: T2).
study_design_info.masking_description: The participant cannot be masked because they realise if they are in group A or B

primary_outcome.description: Score to quantify the particular skill: Minimum / worst performance 8, Max / best performance: 40

primary_outcome.measure: Intraosseous venous access: "Intraosseous Access Performance Assessment Scale"
primary_outcome.description: Score to quantify the particular skill: Minimum / worst performance 0, Max / best performance: 17

arm_group.description: Group A will be video recorded during the performance of the two skills on simulators (i.e. Donati suture and intraosseous venous access) (timepoint: T0). Then group A will watch a standardised video about the skills, then will be again video recorded during the performance of the two skills on simulators (timepoint: T1). After 1 to 2 weeks group A will do self-study, then will be again video recorded during the performance of the two skills on simulators (timepoint: T2).

Group B will be video recorded during the performance of the two skills on simulators (i.e. Donati suture and intraosseous venous access) (timepoint: T0). Then group B will do self-study, then will be again video recorded during the performance of the two skills on simulators (timepoint: T1). After 1 to 2 weeks group B will watch the standardised video about the skills, then will be again video recorded during the performance of the two skills on simulators (timepoint: T2).

intervention.description: watching a video concerning clinical skills.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- medical student in the last year of the curriculum
Exclusion Criteria:
- no medical student in the last year of the curriculum

Department of Anaesthesiology / Klinik für Anästhesiologie, Langenbeckstr. 1, 55131 Mainz, Germany

Lee JC, Boyd R, Stuart P. Randomized controlled trial of an instructional DVD for clinical skills teaching. Emerg Med Australas. 2007 Jun;19(3):241-5.

Shippey SH, Chen TL, Chou B, Knoepp LR, Bowen CW, Handa VL. Teaching subcuticular suturing to medical students: video versus expert instructor feedback. J Surg Educ. 2011 Sep-Oct;68(5):397-402. doi: 10.1016/j.jsurg.2011.04.006. Epub 2011 Jun 25.

Oriot D, Darrieux E, Boureau-Voultoury A, Ragot S, Scépi M. Validation of a performance assessment scale for simulated intraosseous access. Simul Healthc. 2012 Jun;7(3):171-5. doi: 10.1097/SIH.0b013e31824a5c20.
